strings: <voice_0x01001857><se_low>King Clavius: Ah! It's you. Yes, I remember... You are the adventurer I gave the royal magic mirror to some time ago.
<voice_0x01001858><se_low>King Clavius: What brings you here tonight? ...You look like you have something important to tell me.
Show King Clavius the Argon ring?

<voice_0x01001859><se_low>King Clavius: Well, you are a strange one! If you have nothing to say, perhaps you would leave me in peace.
I may not look it, but I am actually rather busy.

<voice_0x0100185A><se_low>King Clavius: That ring! It's set with an Argon heart...
How on earth did you acquire it?
<voice_0x0100185B><se_low>King Clavius: Hmm... I must admit that your tale is enough to give even me pause...
<voice_0x0100185C><se_low>King Clavius: It sounds as if you truly are Eltrio's son.
<voice_0x0100185D><se_low>King Clavius: How else could you possibly know all the things you just told me?
<voice_0x0100185E><se_low>King Clavius: Hm. If my brother had not left his country behind to go after your mother, he would be King of Argonia now.
<voice_0x0100185F><se_low>King Clavius: And if you had been born a prince, then I suppose it would be you marrying Princess Medea tomorrow...
<voice_0x01001860><se_low>King Clavius: But those are just what-ifs.

<voice_0x01001861><se_low>King Clavius: It would throw the kingdom into turmoil if another heir appeared at this late hour.
I cannot possibly recognise your claim.

<voice_0x01001862><se_low>King Clavius: ...Please try not to think badly of me.
You must consider the subject closed.
Please leave now.

<voice_0x01001863><se_low>King Clavius: You're still here? Well, what is it?
Do you have something to say or don't you?

<voice_0x01001877><se_low>King Clavius: Were a new heir to appear out of nowhere,
the whole country would be plunged into confusion. You do understand that?
<voice_0x01001878><se_low>King Clavius: ...I doubt that was your intention, however.
<voice_0x01001879><se_low>King Clavius: But what do you mean by bringing this ring to me now? That Charmles is not worthy to wed Princess Medea?

<voice_0x0100187A><se_low>King Clavius: I grant you, he is immature and...
foolhardy at times.
<voice_0x0100187B><se_low>King Clavius: But as his father, I want to see him happily married to a good woman.
<voice_0x0100187C><se_low>King Clavius: I am told that you have been a close friend of the Princess since childhood.
<voice_0x0100187D><se_low>King Clavius: Do you perhaps...have feelings for her?
<voice_0x0100187E><se_low>King Clavius: I see. Then...could it be that you seek her hand in marriage?
<voice_0x0100187F><se_low>King Clavius: Hm. If you will indulge me, I shall tell you a story about Charmles's grandsire <endash> my father <endash> when he was a young prince.
<voice_0x01001880><se_low>King Clavius: During his travels around the world, he met the young Princess of Trodain, and they fell in love.
<voice_0x01001881><se_low>King Clavius: Unfortunately for the young couple, however, relations between Argonia and Trodain were strained at the time.
<voice_0x01001882><se_low>King Clavius: ...And my father's hopes of marrying the Princess were dashed by staunch opposition from both royal families.

<voice_0x01001883><se_low>King Clavius: As they could not be together, the couple vowed that their unborn children would one day marry instead, to fulfil the promise of their love and forge a bond between the two lands.
<voice_0x01001884><se_low>King Clavius: As it turned out, however, both my father and the Princess of Trodain were blessed with sons.
<voice_0x01001885><se_low>King Clavius: And they passed away without ever seeing their dream realised.
<voice_0x01001886><se_low>King Clavius: So it became my wish to keep the vow they made to each other.
<voice_0x01001887><se_low>King Clavius: That is why I proposed a match between Charmles and Princess Medea.

<voice_0x01001888><se_low>King Clavius: Having sought King Trode's blessing,
I cannot now simply change my mind.
And even if I could, I would not willingly
let my father down.

<voice_0x01001889><se_low>King Clavius: I daresay you do not like my decision,
but at least you understand it. ...That is all.
You may leave.
<voice_0x0100188A><se_low>King Clavius: Good Goddess! You mean to say some other woman stands higher in your affections?

<voice_0x0100188B><se_low>King Clavius: ...Someone you care about enough to wish
to marry?
<voice_0x0100188C><se_low>King Clavius: Then what are you playing at, boy?
<voice_0x0100188D><se_low>King Clavius: If your affections lie elsewhere, why in the world are you causing trouble between Charmles and Medea?

<voice_0x0100188E><se_low>King Clavius: Do you not understand the implications of
your actions?
<voice_0x0100188F><se_low>King Clavius: With this ring, you are claiming to be the son of my brother, Eltrio <endash> my ELDER brother...
<voice_0x01001890><se_low>King Clavius: Don't you see? That gives YOU the right to take Princess Medea's hand in marriage!
<voice_0x01001891><se_low>King Clavius: Tell me, what do you think would happen if word got out that you objected to the union of Charmles and Medea?
<voice_0x01001892><se_low>King Clavius: It wouldn't end with the wedding's cancellation, nor even Argonia's humiliation, I assure you!
<voice_0x01001893><se_low>King Clavius: No, it would inevitably lead to a dispute over who is the rightful heir to the throne!
<voice_0x01001894><se_low>King Clavius: Have you any conception how ruinous your artless meddling could prove!?

<voice_0x01001895><se_low>King Clavius: I have nothing more to say to you.
LEAVE!
<voice_0x01001896><se_low>King Clavius: Don't want to admit to it, eh?
<voice_0x01001897><se_low>King Clavius: All right, let's try again, shall we?
<voice_0x01001898><se_low>King Clavius: Do you, or do you not, have romantic feelings for Princess Medea?
